Unity provides 3 prebuilt render pipelines with different capabilities. Limitless Distortion Effects Vol.2 support all 3 render pipelines.

Inside "Assets\LimitlessUnityDevelopment\Limitless Distortion Vol.2 " folder you can find 3 unity packages.

  1. “URP Limitless Distortion Vol.2.unitypackage” for Universal Render.
  2. “LimitlessDistortionVol.2_HDRP.unitypackage” for High Definition Render Pipeline.
  3. “Built-In Limitless Distortion Vol.2.unitypackage” for Built-In Render Pipeline.

Import needed package according to your Render Pipeline.

After Importing needed package please follow the instructions for your Render Pipeline.

  • URP

  • HDRP

  • Built-In

URP

Setup Effects Automatically

Simply click Tools > Limitless Distortion Vol.2 > Add Render Features. All effects will be added to your current Renderer.

Setup Effects Manually

  1. Open your renderer and click "Add Render Feature".
  2. Add all Limitless Distortion effects you need.
  3. In your scene, add a Volume component to any GameObject you want. In the Volume component, create a new volume profile or use an existing one. Click "Override" and select the needed effect.

Setup Effects to Use Example Scenes

  1. Open your Universal Render Pipeline Asset.
  2. Select Renderer with Limitless Distortion Vol2 Effects in the "Renderer list" field.

Limitless Distortion Vol2 Scene UI

In this example scene, you will see how to use Limitless Distortion Vol.2 for UI elements or any other separate layers.

Follow the video tutorial to apply effects on UI elements or any other separate layers:

How it works:

  1. Make sure that you added Custom Texture_LimitlessDistortion Render feature to your Renderer.
  2. Create a Canvas with the needed UI elements on layer UI.
  3. Create a Render Texture.
  4. Create a separate camera to render the image to the Render Texture.
  5. Change the background type to "Color" (Solid Black).
  6. Change the Volume Mask to the needed layer (for example, UI).
  7. Create a post-process volume to apply the needed effects to UI elements (set the Volume layer to UI).
  8. Create the main post-process volume.
  9. In the main Volume, click "Add Override" and select Limitless Distortion Vol.2/Custom Texture.
  10. Insert the previously created Render Texture into the "Texture" field.
  11. If you want to change the Render Texture resolution to your current resolution automatically, click Add Component > Render Texture Auto Resolution and insert the previously created Render Texture into the "Texture" field.
  12. All done! Now you can see your UI elements with effects rendered separately from other elements in the scene.

NOTICE: Check the order of Limitless Distortion Vol.2 render features in your Renderer. If you want a separate layer to be rendered on top of other layers, ensure that Custom Texture_LimitlessDistortion is at the bottom of the list.

Unity Post-processing Documentation

HDRP

HDRP Effect Setup

To set up Limitless Distortion Vol.2 effects:

Note: By default, your Limitless Distortion Vol.2 effects will not run if you just add them to a Volume.

  1. Go to Edit > Project Settings and select the HDRP Default Settings tab.
  2. Scroll down until you find the "Custom Post Process Orders" section.
  3. Add Limitless Distortion Vol.2 effects to this list so that HDRP can render them.
  4. HDRP allows you to customize the order of your post-processing effects to achieve the most authentic look you want.
  5. To use effects in your Post-processing volume, go to Add Override > Limitless Distortion Vol.2 and select the desired distortion effect.

Manipulating Limitless Distortion Vol.2 Effects Variables

You can find an effects manipulation example script in Limitless Distortion Vol.2 HDRP/EffectsManipulationExample.cs.

How to Apply Effects on UI or Any Other Layer Separately

Mask Separate Layers to Apply Limitless Distortion Vol.2

  1. Create a Render Texture.
  2. Create a new camera that will render the needed layer and insert the Render Texture into the "Target Texture" field.
  3. Insert the recently created Render Texture into the "Mask" field of the needed effect in your Volume component, and select the Mask Channel (e.g., Red Channel).

Built-In

Setup New Effects for Post Processing Stack v2

To use the new effects collection, make sure you have installed the Post Processing package from the Package Manager (Window > Package Manager).

To set up Post Processing Stack v2, follow this guide:
https://docs.unity3d.com/Packages/com.unity.postprocessing@3.3/manual/index.html

In the post-process volume/profile, click Add Effect > Limitless Distortion Vol.2 and select the desired distortion effect.
